page.title: 17Eating out in the area.
page.content: {Stone Manor}was built in 1926 as an eight-bedroomed house. It now has two banqueting suites, a pool, tennis courts, and a French restaurant. Dover sole there costs Â£13.50, and our mums and dads go there for special occasions and dances. The bedrooms have separate bathrooms, and from the top rooms you can see out over all our Domesday block. At{The Granary}you can pile your plate as high as you like, and come back for more. {The {Dog}at Harvington used to be a pub; now it does good bar food and caters for private parties. There's a restaurant as well. The place which most of the families use is {The {Beefeater}at the {Mare and Colt.} There is a big garden for children, and a play area. Children can have a "Mr Men" meal for under a pound before 7:30.
